intro: Gossypium strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf cotton or narrowleaf cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other cotton species and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Gossypium strictum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil.
